topics: Introduction and Overview of Safety in the Construction Industry
readings: Read Articles – SMS, HBR, Corporate Culture
Review: NYC Department of Buildings - Chapter 33

topics: Construction Operations in NYC – DOB and FDNY Requirements
readings: Read – The Accident and the Investigation
Read - Applying an Error Reduction Model to an I2P2 Program

assignments: Guest Lecturer - Michael Presutti, Select Safety

readings: Read - Prevention Through Design for Hazards in Construction – ASSP

topics: Prevention Through Design & Building Information Modeling
assignments: Guest Lecturer - Leo Molina, Mobile Coordination Technology in Safety
Guest Lecturer – Sebastien de Ghellinck, SkillSignal

readings: Review – OSHA web - Cranes & Derricks in Construction
Read - Contract Issues and Construction Safety Management - ASSP

grading.policies: Late assignments are automatically reduced by Canvas at a rate of 10% per day.

policies.attendance: Students must complete the assignments, quizzes, discussions and be actively engaged to be eligible to pass the class.
policies.late_work: Assignments not submitted via Canvas on-time will be late and grade will be reduced.
policies.academic_integrity: All Stevens graduate students promise to be fully truthful and avoid dishonesty, fraud, misrepresentation, and deceit of any type in relation to their academic work.
policies.accommodations: Stevens Institute of Technology is dedicated to providing appropriate accommodations to students with documented disabilities.

important_dates: Sep 7: Class 1 - Introduction and Overview of Safety in the Construction Industry
Sep 19: Class 2 - Safety Management Approaches & Systems
Sep 28: Class 4 - Construction Operations in NYC – DOB and FDNY Requirements
Oct 5: Class 5 - Incident Causation and Investigation
Oct 26: Class 8 - Site Preparation & Interior Construction Operations
Nov 2: Class 9 - Injury and Illness Prevention Programs
Nov 9: Class 10 - Mega Project Safety Orientation Program
Nov 16: Class 11 - Prevention Through Design & Building Information Modeling
Nov 30: Class 12 - Serious Injury and Fatality Management (SIF)
Dec 7: Class 14 - Crane and Hoist Safety

additional_info.course_format: The course will utilize online live lectures through ZOOM and/or pre-recorded lectures, virtual discussions, assignments, and readings.
additional_info.technology_requirements: This course requires the use of LockDown Browser and a webcam for online exams.
additional_info.support_resources: The Office of Counseling and Psychological Services (CAPS) offers free and confidential services to all enrolled students.

instructor.name: Joseph M. Schwed, CSP, SSM, CS, CSFSM, FMA, RPA

_metadata.course_description: A study of safety practices in the construction industry.
learning_outcomes: Discuss occupational safety and health management systems
Assess risk at a construction site using a variety of tools
Understand construction site operations as it pertains to safety management
